name: hydropower plant construction, run-of-river | hydropower plant, run-of-river | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/10631/documentation

This dataset represents the construction of a run-of-river hydropower power plant in Quebec. This dataset is based on study on the production, transmission and distribution of electricity in Quebec. It represents an average of all the run-of-river power plants that belong to Hydro-Quebec, which is the main electricity provider in the region (about 95% of the total electricity produced). The inventory is based on a sample of 42 run-of-river power plants that combine for 13787MW, with different capacity (from 1800 MW to 4MW) and all the dams and derivations that were built to ensure the operation of the plants. Lifetime is assumed to be 100 years for the plant.  The data refers to plant construction of a mix of types of dams built between 1910 and 2014, therefore they might not be representative for an individual type of hydropower power plant. Lifetime is assumed to be 100 years for the plant and 50 for most of the equipments included (turbine-generator, valves, cranes, etc.);[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From reception of mateirals and construction operations (excavation, blasting, etc.)

The activity ends with the start of the plant operation.
It includes:
- land use associated with the infrastructures
- the most important materials used for the construction of the plant and the associated infrastructures: cement, gravel, steel, sand, wood, explosives;
- energy used for the construction;
- decommissioning and waste treatment 
This dataset doesn't include :
- land use for access roads to the power plant
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/422:Construction of utility projects/4220:Construction of utility projects

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Construction data collected for built power plants and infrastructures between 1930 and 2011 but assumed to be equivalent to present construction (energy, explosives and operations). Data for new plants were calculated by linear regression (based on installed power)
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: "The data refers to plant construction of a mix of types of dams built between 1930 and 2011, therefore they might not be representative for an individual type of hydropower power plant.;;All the technologies (type of dam, type of turbine, etc.)  and capacities present in the region are included in the dataset.;Several types of regulation works and dams are included (weight and vault concrete dams, morraine structures, etc.)"
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
Some data are extrapolated from GLO dataset. Uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly
Data for new plants were calculated by linear regression (based on installed power)
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data collection from the company including all its activities

flow.name: hydropower plant, run-of-river
flow.category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/422:Construction of utility projects/4220:Construction of utility projects

exchanges.description:
Calculated value. This value includes the total amount of this material used in the construction of the hydropower plants of Hydro-Quebec and all the associated regulatory infrastrcutures (dams, reservoirs, etc.). All the hydropower plants (20) were included in the calculation. 
The calculation is based on primary data from most of the infrastructures and plants and extrapolations based on the characteristics of the infrastructures (height, width, length, slope).

exchanges.description: Estimated value. As the water was not adressed in the study, an estimation ius made base on ecoinvent datasets. For 1 m3 of concrete 0.8 m3 of gravel, 0.127 m3 of water and 0.073 m3 of cement are mixed. This corresponds to 127 kg of water.
